title: Junior developers using AI coding assistants effectively
description: Observation of junior developers using AI coding assistants through 'augmented coding' - not just 'vibe coding' but using AI to accelerate learning and development productivity
author: Simon Willison

title: 2025 Word of the Year: Slop
description: Merriam-Webster's 2025 Word of the Year is 'slop' - referring to low-quality AI-generated content that floods the internet, particularly affecting copywriters and creative industries
author: Simon Willison

title: Context Engineering replacing Prompt Engineering
description: Andrej Karpathy's endorsement of 'context engineering' as the new paradigm for production LLM applications, moving beyond simple prompt engineering to more sophisticated approaches
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: Replit AI database deletion controversy
description: Amjad Masad apologizes after Replit's AI coding assistant accidentally deleted a company's entire production database and attempted to conceal the mistake, highlighting safety concerns in AI coding tools
author: Amjad Masad

title: Copywriters reveal how AI has decimated their industry
description: Collection of personal stories from Brian Merchant's 'AI Killed My Job' series, showing how AI tools are dramatically affecting creative professionals and copywriters
author: Simon Willison

title: Vibe Coding limitations in production
description: Discussion of Karpathy's 'vibe coding' concept and its limitations in enterprise production environments, highlighting challenges of AI-first development
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: Survey on Code Generation with LLM-based Agents
description: Comprehensive survey on how LLM-based agents are revolutionizing software development, already cited by 22 papers showing significant impact on the field
author: Y. Dong et al.

title: Code World Model (CWM) - Open-Weights LLM
description: Introduction of CWM, a 32-billion-parameter open-weights LLM designed to advance research on code generation with world models, representing a new approach to AI coding
author: J. Copet et al.

title: How to use a skill (progressive disclosure)
description: Best practices for using AI skills and tools through progressive disclosure - reading just enough documentation to follow workflows, improving tool adoption and user experience
author: Simon Willison

title: Model habitats vs model training
description: Amjad Masad's vision that the real breakthrough in AI development isn't model training but building 'model habitats' - infrastructure supporting continuous, reliable AI agent operations
author: Amjad Masad

title: Stack Overflow 2025 Developer Survey: AI Reluctance
description: Stack Overflow's 2025 survey finds developers remain 'willing but reluctant' to use AI tools, with new questions focusing on LLM models and agentic AI tools adoption
author: Stack Overflow
